Summary: Red lights observed approximately 25 miles north of Las Vegas
divs: sighting detailson december 19, 1989 at approximately 7:15 pm, i and another person witnessed an unusual aireal event 25 miles north of las vegas. sky was clear at the time and sunlight was starting to recede, so timeline may not be exact. we were traveling from los angeles in route to aspen, colorado. i was a driving a 28 foot u-haul truck, loaded with luggage and christmas decorations for employer's winter home in aspen. we pulled off on the north bound shoulder of interstate 15 to change driving positions as i wanted to drink a cup of coffee. we both moved to the rear of the truck, and at the rear of the vehicle i caught a flashing red light in my view. the light was a single light, approximately 5000' in altitude, appeared stationary, distance 2 miles, southeast of our position. within 15-20 seconds a second light appeared, spaced north of first light at same altitude. the second light did not flash, and was close in distance to first light. the first light stopped flashing and remained constant, as the second. when the first light stopped flasing, a third light appeared, and than a fourth, each lighting several seconds after the previous, and all remaining lit, no flashing. within a minute or so a total of 12 lights were visible, all evenly spaced, and all red in color. the distance from the first light to the last, appeared to be a mile or so in length. the lights remained at altitude and did not appear to be moving laterally. in short order we heard the sound of a jet aircraft, but i could not get a vector on the noise. as i turned back to the lights, the first light that appeared flashed several times, and disappeared. the remaining lights than moved from a linear formation south to north, and rotated to north\east - south\west direction. as they moved it appeared that the formation was in a v pattern, with the point facing south\east. the lights appeared to now be moving south\east towards the colorado river area. the jet noise became increasingly louder, and we observed two f-15 fighter aircraft moving at a very high rate of speed. the aircraft crossed in front of our vehicle, traveling south\east and vectored directly toward the lights. i am very familiar with aircraft types, and these aircraft had twin vertical tail sections as found on usaf f-15 fighters. the aircraft closed quickly on the lights and than the red lights moved in unison at an extremely high rate of speed away from f-15's in a south\easterly direction, and disappeared in short order. the fighters' lights could be visble for a short period there after, however it was quite evident that the f-15's were considerably slower than the v-shapped light formaton. shortly after fighters' lights disappeared we heard several loud booms, which we assumed were sonic booms. the experience was quite stunning, and later that evening we made a call from our motel room in st. george, utah to nellis afb. my partner made the call and transferred to base operations. they seemed disinterested, and stated that they could not comment on military flight operations, but suggested that we contact the faa in regards to the red lights.
